title: Graduate-Level Mathematics Writing Quality Improvement Program Using Technology-Enhanced Peer Assessment

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding basic academic writing structures and the ability to explain mathematical concepts
context.additional_context: Academic Writing & Peer Review Competency Development for Pre-Service/In-Service Math Teachers

learning_goals: Learners can apply a three-stage logical structure (problem definition–solution strategy–conclusion) to write academic abstracts when explaining mathematical concepts.

Learners can provide peer feedback on mathematical writing using technical tools (shared document platforms) according to five or more specific criteria (clarity, logical coherence, mathematical accuracy, etc.).
Learners can achieve writing quality metrics (20% improvement in structuring score, 15% improvement in expert evaluation score) during the feedback incorporation process.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
